docs.snippet: Paul Ryan's future as House speaker has been such a topic of speculation that even the simple question of whether he will seek re-election to his Wisconsin seat remains secret.

headline.print_headline: Speaker Ryan Is Expected to Seek Re-election; Will He Stay?
headline.main: Speaker Ryan Is Expected to Seek Re-election; Will He Stay?

docs.snippet: The couple met in 2010 while both were working for the New Hampshire Democratic Party.

docs.snippet: India on Wednesday allowed the import of used goods for repair and refurbishing on condition that the imported items are  exported - a move that could entice companies like smartphone maker Apple further into the Indian market.

headline.print_headline: India Beckons Big Tech Firms, Allows Imports of Used Goods for Repair
headline.main: India Beckons Big Tech Firms, Allows Imports of Used Goods for Repair

docs.snippet: A self-inflicted gunshot wound, not a bullet fired by a sheriff's deputy, killed a 17-year-old who had just shot another student at a Maryland high school last week, authorities have said.

headline.print_headline: Maryland School Gunman Died of Self-Inflicted Gunshot, Police Say
headline.main: Maryland School Gunman Died of Self-Inflicted Gunshot, Police Say

headline.print_headline: The Latest: Japan Says Talks Must End N. Korean Nuke Program
headline.main: The Latest: Japan Says Talks Must End N. Korean Nuke Program

docs.snippet: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has pledged to denuclearise and meet U.S. officials, China said on Wednesday after an historic meeting with President Xi Jinping, who promised China would uphold its friendship with its isolated neighbour.

headline.print_headline: China Says North Korea Pledges Denuclearisation During Friendly Visit
headline.main: China Says North Korea Pledges Denuclearisation During Friendly Visit
